outline.ch:
A composite course covering experimental techniques commonly used in fields of atomic and molecular sciences, physical chemistry and material sciences. The five different topics will be taught by five different specialists in each field.
1. Laboratory Electronics (8 hours)
2. Optics, Lasers and Detection (8 hours)
3. Introduction to Quantitative Spectroscopy (4 hours)
4. Electron Microscopy (4 hours)
5. Optical Vibrational Spectroscopy (4 hours)

textbook.ch:
1. Laboratory Electronics：
(1) The art of electronics, 3rd ed. Horowitz and Hill, Cambridge Univ. Press, New York (2015).
(2)Building scientific apparatus, 4th ed. Moore, Davis, and Coplan, Perseus Books, Cambridge Massachusetts (2009).
2. Optics, Lasers and Detection：
(1)Fundamentals of Photonics, 2nd ed., B. E. A. Saleh and M. C. Teich (John Wiley ＆ Sons, New York, 2007)
(2)Laser Spectroscopy: Basic concepts and instrumentation, 2nd ed., W. Demtröder (Springer-Verlag, Berlin, 1996)
(3)Building Scientific Apparatus, 4th ed., J. H. Moore, C. C. Davis, M. A. Coplan (Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 2009)
(4)Classnote
3. Introduction to Quantitative Spectroscopy ：
(1)Laser Spectroscopy 1: Basic Principles, by Wolfgang Demtröder
(2)Laser Spectroscopy 2: Experimental Techniques, by Wolfgang Demtröder
(3)Spectroscopy and Optical Diagnostics for Gases, by Ronald K Hanson; R Mitchell Spearrin; Christopher S Goldenstein
(4)All of the listed e-books can be download from NTU librar
4. Electron Microscopy：
(1)Handbook of Biological confocal microscopy, 3rd ed., James B. Pawley (Springer, 2006)
Basic Confocal Microscopy, 2nd ed., W. Gray (Jay) Jerome • Robert L. Price (Springer Nature Switzerland AG 2011, 2018)
5. Optical Vibrational Spectroscopy：
(1) Theory of Sum Frequency Generation Spectroscopy, Akihiro Morita, Springer (2018),
      ISSN 2192-6603 (electronic).
(2) Group Theory: Application to the physics of Condensed Matters, M. S. Dresselhaus, G. Dresselhaus, A. Jorio, Springer (2008), ISBN: 978-3-540-32897-1.

gradMethod.ch:
1. Laboratory Electronics：
Written examination (80％) and response in the class (20％)
Sample questions can be downloaded from http://idv.sinica.edu.tw/jwang/TIGP/sample-problems.pdf
2. Optics, Lasers and Detection：
(1)A construction plan for an optical setup (40％)
(2)A hand-on experiment of Twyman-Green interferometer (40％)
(3)Class attendance (20％)
3. Introduction to Quantitative Spectroscopy：
(1) Class attendance (20％)
(2) Response during the class (50％)
(3) Literature report (30％): search and summarize one spectroscopic techniques.
4. Electron Microscopy ：
(1) Class attendance (40％)
(2) Homework (60％)
(a) describe some electron microscopy
(b) how to apply some specific electron microscopy in research
(c) practical analysis in the experiments
5. Optical Vibrational Spectroscopy：
(1) Class attendance (40％)
(2) Homework (60％)
